item.description:
"Food made with love...youâ€™ll taste the difference.'' That's the slogan on the menu at Peppercornz on Main, which moved from cramped quarters on Columbian Avenue in Weymouth to take over the space formerly occupied by Reggio in September of 2008. All available evidence seems to indicate that quite a few people concur with the sentiment; among them the Patriot Ledger's Mimi Claffey and, more recently, the Phantom Gourmet.

How do you make yet another Italian restaurant on the South Shore something special? Chef Linda Varasso does it by drawing on the culinary heritage passed down to her by a large Italian family.

We'll be heading to Peppercornz on Saturday, November 14th at 6:00 PM to see (and taste!) for ourselves just what she and co-owner Taylor Beckett are doing that's so appetizing.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Peppercornz on Main
Saturday, November 14, 2009 @ 6:00pm
1037 Main Street
Route 18
South Weymouth, MA 02190
781-331-9931
www.peppercornz.com


Organizers: Mike and Jeanne

Min/Max: None at this time.

Guests: 1 per Member

Price Range: Dinner offerings range from $9.99 (Pasta Marinara) to $22.99 (Cioppino), with quite a few selections under $16.00.

Cash Only Policy: Please bring cash! Paying for all of our meals in cash has been SSDOMG'S policy for over three years. It allows us to avoid the confusion of having the waitstaff run multiple credit card slips and generally helps to keep things simpler for everyone.

Event Fee: Annual Members - None. Group Members and Guests - $2.00.

RSVP Deadline: 7:00 PM on Friday, November 13, 2009 Any changes made after this time may not be seen by an Event Organizer. Changes to No after this point will be considered No-Shows per our guidelines on the About Us page.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Directions: Peppercornz is located at 1037 Main Street (Route 18) in South Weymouth.

From Route 3 North (Coming from Cape Cod): Take Exit 15 (South Hingham, South Weymouth) and turn right off the ramp towards Derby St., Weymouth, passing back over Route 3. Go straight through one stoplight (Pine St., Church of the Nazarene on far left corner), then turn left at the next light onto Pleasant St.

Follow Pleasant St. straight through Columbian Square (a four or five corner intersection that should have a traffic light but doesn't).

The next stoplight is at the intersection of Pleasant St. and Main St. (Route 18). Turn left (South) onto Route 18. After turning onto Route 18, you should see a Friendly's coming up on your right. Peppercornz is on your right in the strip mall immediately after Friendly's.

From Route 3 South (Coming from Boston): Take exit 16B (Routh 18 South). Merge onto Route 18 and follow it South towards Abington. Go straight through four stoplights (Middle St., Park Ave., Columbian St., then Pleasant St.) Just after you go through the light at Pleasant St (Walgreen's is on the near right corner, Liberty Travel on the far right) you will see a Friendly's coming up on your right. Peppercornz is on your right in the strip mall immediately after Friendly's.
item.how_to_find_us: Our reservation is under both 'Mike' and 'South Shore Meetup Group'.

group.name: The South Shore Dining Out Meetup Group

item.name: "P" is for Peppercornz On Main!
